forumNotes.author: pecd.net
forumNotes.content:
Hi,  

i create my iso with this command:  

mkisofs.exe -rdNlDTJ -force-uppercase -hide boot.catalog -duplicates-once -joliet-long -hide-joliet-trans-tbl -volid "VPE c't edition" -eltorito-boot "boot/grldr" -no-emul-boot -boot-load-size 4 -boot-info-table -o "c:\\pedevel\\vpe2009\\ISO\\vpe-core.iso" "c:\\pedevel\\vpe2009\\target\\vpe-core"  

but for some reason unknown to me the boot.catalog file is still visible when i look with total commander after i boot vistaPE.  

Anyone has an idea why that is?  

Thanks !

forumNotes.author: cdob
forumNotes.content: > mkisofs.exe -rdNlDTJ -force-uppercase -hide boot.catalog -duplicates-once -joliet-long -hide-joliet-trans-tbl -volid "VPE c't edition" -eltorito-boot "boot/grldr" -no-emul-boot -boot-load-size 4 -boot-info-table -o "c:\\pedevel\\vpe2009\\ISO\\vpe-core.iso" "c:\\pedevel\\vpe2009\\target\\vpe-core" That's file system ISO9660 with Rock Ridge extension. In addition there is file system Joliet. > but for some reason unknown to me the boot.catalog file is still visible when i look with total commander after i boot vistaPE. Which file system or extension does total commander list? What does ISOBuster list? Do you require Joliet file system? manpage: -hide glob > Hide glob from being seen on the ISO9660 or Rock Ridge directory. > > -hide-joliet glob > Hide glob from being seen on the Joliet directory. Try ``` mkisofs.exe -rdNlDT -joliet-long -hide boot.catalog -hide-joliet boot.catalog -hide-joliet-trans-tbl -volid "VPE c't edition" -eltorito-boot "boot/grldr" -no-emul-boot -boot-load-size 4 -o "c:\pedevel\vpe2009\ISO\vpe-core.iso" "c:\pedevel\vpe2009\target\vpe-core" ```

forumNotes.author: pecd.net
forumNotes.content: tc does the same as explorer.exe...maybe i do not need joliet...will try some settings...thanks...
